info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 1:53PM EDT until July 15 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following independent city, City of Roanoke.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has exited the area, with as much as 1 inch of rain having fallen between 12 pm and 1 pm. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Back Creek, Roanoke River, Gum Spring Branch, Carvin Creek and Murray Run. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Vinton... Cave Spring... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
